turns.content:
Certainly, here is a five-day meal plan for someone unskilled in preparing food using ingredients easily found in a Norwegian grocery store such as Rema 1000. Each day has breakfast, lunch, dinner, and an evening snack, and no meal except dinner should take more than 8 minutes to prepare. I have tried to limit the number of different ingredients and reuse them where possible to make shopping easier.

Day 1:

* Breakfast: Greek yogurt with honey and granola
* Lunch: Ham and cheese sandwich with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Chicken stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Apple slices with peanut butter

Shopping list for Day 2:

* Greek yogurt
* Honey
* Granola
* Bread
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Pre-cooked chicken
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Apples
* Peanut butter

Day 2:

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with banana and cinnamon
* Lunch: Grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup
* Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted vegetables, served with boiled potatoes
* Evening snack: Dark chocolate square

Shopping list for Day 3:

* Oatmeal
* Bananas
* Cinnamon
* Bread
* Cheese
* Tomato soup
* Salmon fillet
* Pre-cut vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots)
* Potatoes
* Dark chocolate

Day 3:

* Breakfast: Peanut butter and banana smoothie
* Lunch: Ham and cheese wrap with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Grapes

Shopping list for Day 4:

* Bananas
* Peanut butter
* Tortilla wraps
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Beef strips
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Grapes

Day 4:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with toast
* Lunch: Chicken Caesar salad (use pre-cooked chicken and Caesar dressing)
* Dinner: Pork chops with roasted vegetables, served with boiled potatoes
* Evening snack: Clementine

Shopping list for Day 5:

* Eggs
* Bread
* Lettuce
* Pre-cooked chicken
* Caesar dressing
* Pork chops
* Pre-cut vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots)
* Potatoes
* Clementines

Day 5:

* Breakfast: Yogurt with mixed berries and honey
* Lunch: Chicken quesadilla (use pre-cooked chicken and pre-shredded cheese)
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Dark chocolate square

Shopping list for next week:

* Greek yogurt
* Honey
* Granola
* Bread
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Pre-cooked chicken
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Apples
* Peanut butter
* Oatmeal
* Bananas
* Cinnamon
* Tomato soup
* Salmon fillet
* Pre-cut vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots)
* Potatoes
* Beef strips
* Lettuce
* Caesar dressing
* Pork chops
* Tortilla wraps
* Pre-shredded cheese
* Mixed berries
* Clementines
* Dark chocolate

Note: All cooking times may vary depending on individual equipment and skill level.

Create a five-day meal plan for someone unskilled in preparing food. Only use things that can be found easily in a Norwegian grocery store such as Rema 1000. Each day should have: breakfast, lunch, dinner and evening meal. No meal except maybe dinner should take more than 8 minutes to prepare. For each day, add a shopping list for the next day. Try to limit the amount of different things I need to buy. Reuse ingredients if possible. Avoid anything vegan. Avoid tuna. Avoid tomatoes. Avoid croutons. Avoid beans. Avoid turkey. Avoid chocolate. Avoid greek yoghurt. If instructions are ambiguous, let me know.

Sure, here is a five-day meal plan for someone unskilled in preparing food, using ingredients easily found in a Norwegian grocery store such as Rema 1000. Each day has breakfast, lunch, dinner, and an evening snack, and no meal except dinner should take more than 8 minutes to prepare. I have tried to limit the number of different ingredients and reuse them where possible to make shopping easier.

Day 1:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with toast and a glass of orange juice
* Lunch: Ham and cheese sandwich with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Apple slices with peanut butter

* Ham

* Beef strips

Day 2:

* Dinner: Pork chops with roasted vegetables, served with boiled potatoes

Shopping list for Day 4:

Day 4:

* Breakfast: Peanut butter and banana smoothie
* Lunch: Ham and cheese wrap with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Pear slices with cheese

Shopping list for Day 5:

* Bananas

* Tortilla wraps
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Beef strips
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Pears

Day 5:

* Breakfast: Toast with scrambled eggs and a glass of orange juice
* Lunch: Chicken quesadilla (use pre-cooked chicken and pre-shredded cheese)

* Evening snack: Apple slices with peanut butter
